page.title: 19SPECIAL SCHOOLS IN RASTRICK
page.content: The William Henry Smith School, formerly an orphanage and named after its founder, is a non-maintained school recognised by the Department of Education and Science. It caters for boys from 11 to 16 years of age, who suffer from emotional and social difficulties, on a residential basis. The boys are referred by Local Education Authorities, where they cannot be adequately catered for in day schools. The emphasis is on character building and helping the boys to realise their full potential. Outdoor activities play an important part in this process, and the boys are a familiar sight in the district. Hillside Special School caters for about 30 children with severe physical and mental handicaps. It has a good relationship with the local community, which is active in fund raising.
